Creating Product Classes

Product classes act as templates for product models. You can create a product class, then create many products based on the class that inherit all its attributes, coverages, insured items, insured parties, rating facts, and rules.

Do you have a lot of similar (but not exactly the same) insurance products you sell? If so, product classes can help you create those product models much more quickly.

New to Vlocity product modeling? You probably don't want to start here. Instead, start by reading Child Specs for Root Products. Then read about Insurance Product Inheritance. Then see Root Product Specs.

Next Steps

After you've created your product class or classes, you can go on to create root product specs based on those classes. To learn how, see Root Product Specs.

Creating a Product Class
Wait! Before you put together a product class, Vlocity recommends that you do these tasks:
Cloning a Product Class
Rather than creating every product class you need from scratch, if you plan to create multiple product classes with many similar details, child specs, rules, or attributes, you can save time by cloning the first one you create.
